meico.mpm.elements.styles.defs

Class AccentuationPatternDef

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.xml.AbstractXmlSubtree
      • meico.mpm.elements.styles.defs.AbstractDef
        • meico.mpm.elements.styles.defs.AccentuationPatternDef

  • public class AccentuationPatternDef
extends AbstractDef
    This class interfaces MPM's articulationPattern elements.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      • addAccentuation

        public int addAccentuation(nu.xom.Element xml)
        add a given xml representation of an MPM accentuation element to this accentuationPatternDef
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the index at which it has been added

      • addAccentuationToArrayList

        private int addAccentuationToArrayList(double[] accentuation,
                                       nu.xom.Element xml)
        add the accentuation at the right beat position (the xml can be unsorted, this.accentuations should be sorted)
        Parameters:
        accentuation - the accentuation {beat, value, transition.from, transition.to}
        Returns:
        the index at which the accentuation has been added

      • sortXml

        private void sortXml()
        The accentuation pattern elements can be unsorted in the xml source. This method sorts them according to the list maintained internally.

      • removeAccentuation

        public void removeAccentuation(int index)
        remove an accentuation from this accentuationPatternDef

      • getAllAccentuations

        public java.util.ArrayList<KeyValue<double[],nu.xom.Element>> getAllAccentuations()
        access the accentuation pattern
        Returns:
        a sorted list of arrays of the form ([beat, value, transition.from, transition.to], Element)

      • getAccentuationAttributes

        public double[] getAccentuationAttributes(int index)
        access the accentuation at the specified index
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        the accentuation as an array of the form {beat, value, transition.from, transition.to} or null if index out of bounds

        access the accentuation element
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getAccentuationAt

        public double getAccentuationAt(double beatPosition)
        compute the accentuation value for a given position within the accentuation pattern
        Parameters:
        beatPosition - 1.0 (not 0.0!) is the beginning of the pattern (in musical terms: the 1st beat)
        Returns:
        the accentuation value; it needs to be scaled to actual velocity

      • size

        public int size()
        get the count of accentuations in this accentuation pattern

        the count of accentuations in this accentuation pattern
